title: Research and Markets: China Essential Oil Industry Report 2015
text:
Related Content 
DUBLIN--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- 
Research and Markets ( http://www.researchandmarkets.com/research/fq8bnf/development_and ) has announced the addition of the "Development and Market of the Essential Oil Industry in China" report to their offering. 
There is a huge demand for the Chinese fragrances market, though Chinese consumers have weak brand loyalty. People are healthcare and beauty conscious, as result, the Chinese essential oil market was well developed in 2014, when the sales reached Yen 10.3 billion. 
There are two advantages in the Chinese market; firstly, there is a huge users base in the Chinese skin care market and the demand is growing. Since the Chinese economy is developing quick in the recent decade, not only do urban female consumers purchase essential oil, but also the tier-2, tier-3 cities' female consumers. Secondly, essential oil products are underdeveloped; there is still huge market potential in the skin care market. 
Key Topics Covered: 
I Essential Oil Industry In China 
II Import And Export, 2010-2015 
III Chinese Essential Oil Industry Chain 
IV Chinese Essential Oil Industry Competition 
V Companies
